problems.solution: Use Distributivity or extract components: get "P" and "Q ∨ R", apply Disjunctive Syllogism to get "R", Modus Ponens to get "S", then Conjunction.

natural_language_premises: If the chemical reaction occurs (P), then heat is generated (Q).
If heat is generated (Q), then the container expands (R).
If the container expands (R), then pressure increases (S).
If pressure increases (S), then a valve opens (T).
If a valve opens (T), then gas is released (U).
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Reaction occurs', Q = 'Heat generated', R = 'Container expands', S = 'Pressure increases', T = 'Valve opens', U = 'Gas released', V = 'Lab evacuated'. Chain all five conditionals using Hypothetical Syllogism four times to get P → U, then apply Modus Ponens with P to conclude U.
interpretation_hints: Build the entire chain through five implications
Each step depends on the previous

natural_language_premises: If the student studies consistently (P), then they understand the material (Q).
If they understand the material (Q), then both they pass the exam (R) and feel confident (S).
If they pass the exam (R), then they earn college credit (T).
If they earn college credit (T), then they graduate on time (U).
If they graduate on time (U), then they enter the job market sooner (V).
problems.natural_language_conclusion: They enter the job market sooner (V).
problems.description: Complex chain with compound intermediate step
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Studies consistently', Q = 'Understands material', R = 'Passes exam', S = 'Feels confident', T = 'Earns credit', U = 'Graduates on time', V = 'Enters job market'. Apply Modus Ponens to P → Q to get Q. Apply Modus Ponens to Q → (R ∧ S) to get R ∧ S. Extract R, then chain R → T → U → V using Hypothetical Syllogism to get R → V. Apply Modus Ponens to conclude V.

variable_definitions.V: they enter the job market sooner

interpretation_hints: Extract the needed component to continue the chain
